page.title: 09Pocket Money - ages 9 to 11
page.content: We asked the children in our class about their pocket money. Two children did not get any while one receives as much as Â£3.00 a week. Kerry and Mark don't lose out because they get sweets, drinks, ice cream etc. instead of pocket money. The median weekly amount is Â£1.00 and the mean Â£1.35. Girls do better than boys getting 20 pence more on average. Most of the pocket money is saved for things like holidays, presents or more expensive things like watches or remote control cars. Of Zoey's Â£1 pocket money she spends 60p on sweets like chocolate bars and chewing gum and 40p on pop stickers. These are pictures of different pop groups. You buy a book to put the stickers in. Five stickers cost 20p. The book tells you about the groups as well.
